titleStmt.title: The Doctors last vvill and testament being a most pleasant dialogue between Doctor Cousin and a fellow of his owne colledge, desiring him to resigne his mastership.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Wing.
"A satire on Dr. John Cosin, Tater bishop of Durham, for his insistence on liturgical ritual at Cambridge University"--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Imperfect: pages torn, with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
